description: Vegetarian korma is a creamy and flavorful Indian dish made with mixed vegetables cooked in a rich and aromatic sauce. It's a comforting and satisfying meal that pairs well with rice or bread.

ingredients.name: Mixed vegetables (such as potatoes, carrots, peas, cauliflower)
Cashew nuts
ingredients.qty: 1/4 cup, soaked in warm water for 15 minutes

steps: Heat oil or ghee in a large skillet or pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies to the skillet. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add soaked cashew nuts to the skillet along with yogurt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt to the skillet. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes.
Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and mix until they are well coated with the masala.
Cover the skillet and let the vegetables cook on low heat for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are cooked through and tender.
Once the vegetables are cooked, add fresh cream to the skillet and mix well.
Serve hot with rice or bread. Enjoy your delicious vegetarian korma!
